description: Won't start on ubuntu 22.04, so I couldn't test it.

The batch split options make it very easy to automate splitting large files based on various settings such as setting a time length to split each track into or setting the number of tracks to set at equal length.

Excellent Tool. very fast.
Interface could use some improvement for ease of use.
windows 10 version kept Crashing.

Thanks.
I don't recommend for someone is looking for a stem splitter

I used mp3directcut for some time for cutting tracks from big mp3 files. Decided to try this one. Its UI is so inconvenient. Searched for how to cut a piece and save the piece into a new file for 5-10 minutes
summary: Hard to figure out how to use it

description: I'm on Ubuntu 20.04 and I just couldn't figure it out how to make it work

Could need a little nicer GUI, and while that isn't really important for me it would probably help a lot when you want to manually split a file.
For batch/automatic splitting you have some options like every x seconds, in a set number of part etc.
I wanted to split large mp3 files (audiobooks, several hours, one file)
 and it, well, simply did that with a few clicks while being really fast.
Downloading, settings and then processing was all in all faster than writing this review.
summary: Does exactly what it's supposed todo and fast
